Text: You sit down and get back to work, downing your cheap, cold coffee fast so you don't have to taste it.
You type away, thinking of nothing but the task before you.
You let your ramen grow cold.
You make it past the halfway mark and breathe a sigh of relief. You shouldn't be so hard on yourself. Everyone procrastinates work all the time.
You wind up a forkful of noodles and check the time.
You quickly compose an email to your professor explaining in the best, most professional language you can manage that you need an extension.
Hopefully enough other students had the same idea and tomorrow you'll wake up to a positive reply.
You hear her lightly step from the front door to her room.
With your email sent and nothing left to do but hope, you turn in what you have so far and give up for the night.
Before you sleep, though, you should bring the mug and fork back to the kitchen at least. You can wash them in the morning.
